adrFormatAddress: 4001 Broadway, New York, NY 10032, USA

editorialSummary.text: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.

originalText.text: Nice place; convenient public transportation - buses/subways/locals/ expresses.  But right now, they're closed for interior, remodeling purposes.  ( So if you want a tasty, inexpensive bagel -of any kind- go next door to Mike's!

text.text: Nice place; convenient public transportation - buses/subways/locals/ expresses.  But right now, they're closed for interior, remodeling purposes.  ( So if you want a tasty, inexpensive bagel -of any kind- go next door to Mike's!

originalText.text:
Ordered a mango dragonfruit lemonade and received just lemonade.  They didn't tell me they were out of the dragonfruit.

If this was what I was going to get i wouldn't have ordered it. One worker here saw my disappointment and ended up putting strawberries in the drink. Thank you to them. It's something.

Service here isn't so great. Saw an elderly woman right after me have issues with her drink not being made correctly. In addition, was rude to her. These drinks as pricey, let's make them right. Or least say you don't have the ingredients to make them properly.  Other Starbucks compensate for waiting too long, incorrect orders, not being satisfied etc. Not that they all have to, just note this Starbucks does not.

originalText.text:
Typical quality of service you would expect from Starbucks but the catch here is to make sure that there are open especially in the morning. I even ordered food once on the app and when I showed up the door was closed and workers inside wouldn't bother to open the door and they showed me 7 fingers...am assuming they were trying to tell me they are opening at 7am. I didn't bother to get that latte and bagel I paid for that morning cause I was too upset with them.

So in conclusion if they are open, if are not backed up with orderes and if they  actually have the products ...there is a chance you gonna get decent  drink and or a snack.

originalText.text: Everything was great! First time since covid doing Starbucks again, however the only negative was another customer while at register asking for my change $2-3...that was something I did not expect. And Service is a lot slower than it use to be at a Starbucks but I get it, people are burnt out and way over worked...I appreciated how well the barista handled a lady too that walked right in and demanded water!!! Nothing about Starbucks or employees that is about the type of other customers I never expected at Starbucks...makes it sort of not a relaxed environment for everyone else working and customers. Hope they can maybe get some sort of security for the safety of everyone. ☆☆☆☆☆

originalText.text:
This place is always filled with people and normally that would be fine but they spend all their energy on mobile orders that they barely take care of the people who order in store. If the mobile orders are so overwhelming then stop taking them for a bit.

Also why does it say you’re open at 5am and it’s 5:15 and the doors are locked?
I walked to the door at 5:09 and the doors were locked and they put 5 up to say they would open in 5m.
We came back in 5 m , door still locked , the girl who said 5m looked up, rolled her eyes and came to open the door. So that was a nice way to start the morning.

Walked in, no one said anything, no greeting. Just a negative atmosphere.

I work in the area so I’m unfortunately here often and it’s my least favorite store but I do enjoy their coffee.

Not a fan of the employees and service here.
